workflow.name: Jarvis: productivity AI agent for tasks, calendar, email & expense using MCPs
workflow.description:
## Whoâ€™s it for
This template is designed for anyone who wants to use **Telegram as a personal AI assistant hub**.  
If you often juggle tasks, emails, calendars, and expenses across multiple tools, this workflow consolidates everything into one seamless AI-powered agent.

## What it does
Jarvis listens to your Telegram messages (text or audio) and processes them with OpenAI.  
Based on your request, it can:
- âœ… Manage tasks (create, complete, or delete)  
- ðŸ“… Handle calendar events (schedule, reschedule, or check availability)  
- ðŸ“§ Send, draft, or fetch emails with Gmail  
- ðŸ‘¥ Retrieve Google Contacts  
- ðŸ’µ Log and track expenses  

All responses are returned directly to Telegram, giving you a unified command center.

## How to set up
1. Clone this template into your n8n workspace.  
2. Connect your accounts (Telegram, Gmail, Google Calendar, Contacts, etc.).  
3. Add your OpenAI API key in the **Credentials** section.  
4. Test by sending a Telegram message like â€œCreate a meeting tomorrow at 3pmâ€ or â€œAdd expense $50 for lunch.â€  or "Draft a reply with a project proposal to that email from Steve"

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)  
- Telegram Bot API credentials  
- Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Contacts credentials (optional, if using those features)  
- OpenAI API key  
- ElevenLabs API Key (optional, if you need audio note support)

## How to customize
- Swap Gmail with another email provider by replacing the Gmail MCP node.  
- Add additional MCP integrations (e.g., Notion, Slack, CRM tools).  
- Adjust memory length to control how much context Jarvis remembers.  

With this template, you can transform Telegram into your **all-in-one AI assistant**, simplifying workflows and saving hours every week.

parameters.toolDescription: Reply to an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message; Message (string) - the reply content; Attachment_Field_Name (string) - input field name containing attachments; BCC (string) - comma-separated BCC recipients; CC (string) - comma-separated CC recipients.

Retrieve multiple email messages based on filters. AI-configurable parameters: Return_All (boolean) - whether to return all matching messages; Search (string) - Gmail query string to filter messages; Received_After (string) - datetime (RFC3339) after which messages are received; Received_Before (string) - datetime before which messages are received; Sender (string) - email address of the sender.

Add one or more labels to an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to label; Label_Names_or_IDs (string) - comma-separated label names or IDs to apply.
Retrieve a list of labels. AI-configurable parameters: Return_All (boolean) - whether to return all labels.

parameters.subject: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Subject', ``, 'string') }}
parameters.toolDescription: Create an email draft. AI-configurable parameters: Subject (string) - the subject of the draft; Message (string) - the body of the draft; Attachment_Field_Name__in_Input_ (string) - input field name containing attachments; BCC (string) - comma-separated BCC recipients; CC (string) - comma-separated CC recipients.

nodes.name: Finance Manager MCP Server
nodes.notes:
ðŸš€ MCP TRIGGER

This is the entry point for AI interactions with Google Sheets. The MCP (Model Context Protocol) trigger allows AI models to call any of the connected Google Sheets tools based on user requests.

Key Features:
â€¢ Enables natural language spreadsheet commands
â€¢ Routes AI requests to appropriate Sheets operations
â€¢ Provides context-aware data management
â€¢ Supports complex multi-step data workflows
â€¢ Handles dynamic sheet and document selection

nodes.name: Get all Expenses
nodes.notes:
ðŸ“Š READ SPREADSHEET DATA

Retrieve and analyze data from Google Sheets. Perfect for AI to read, process, and extract insights from spreadsheet content.

Use Cases:
â€¢ "Read data from the Sales sheet"
â€¢ "Get all entries from A1:E100"
â€¢ "Show me the data in the Budget spreadsheet"
â€¢ "Extract customer information from the CRM sheet"

AI Parameters:
â€¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
â€¢ Sheet_Name: Specific sheet tab name
â€¢ Range: Cell range to read (optional)

nodes.name: Create Expense
nodes.notes:
ðŸ—‘ï¸ CLEAR SPREADSHEET DATA

Remove data from specific ranges or entire sheets. Useful for resetting data, clearing temporary calculations, or preparing sheets for new data.

Use Cases:
â€¢ "Clear all data from the temp sheet"
â€¢ "Remove entries from A1:E100"
â€¢ "Clean up the old data in column C"
â€¢ "Reset the calculation area"

AI Parameters:
â€¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
â€¢ Sheet_Name: Sheet to clear data from
â€¢ Range: Specific range to clear

âš ï¸ Use with caution - data will be permanently removed!

nodes.name: Delete Expense
nodes.notes:
âž• ADD NEW DATA

Append new rows of data to existing sheets. Perfect for adding records, logging events, or inserting new entries without affecting existing data.

Use Cases:
â€¢ "Add a new customer to the CRM sheet"
â€¢ "Log today's sales data"
â€¢ "Insert a new project entry"
â€¢ "Record the meeting notes"

AI Parameters:
â€¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
â€¢ Sheet_Name: Sheet to add data to
â€¢ Data_To_Add: Array/object of new data

Features:
â€¢ Automatically finds next empty row
â€¢ Preserves existing data
â€¢ Supports multiple columns

options.systemMessage:
=You are Jarvis, an intelligent productivity assistant designed to help manage daily tasks, communications, and schedules efficiently. You have access to multiple tools and should use them proactively to assist the user.

## Core Identity
- You are professional, helpful, and proactive
- Always maintain a personal assistant tone - attentive but not overly casual
- Use "Jitesh Dugar" as the user's name in all communications
- Current date and time: {{ $now }}
- Timezone: Asia/Kolkata

## Available Capabilities

### Email Management (Gmail MCP)
- Read, send, reply to, and draft emails
- Organize emails with labels
- Search and filter emails by various criteria
- Always use well-formatted HTML for email composition
- Include proper signatures with "Jitesh Dugar"
- If you're asked to send an email, just use the 'Google Contacts MCP' to get their email address first, then confirm from the user

### Calendar Management (Calendar MCP)
- Check availability and schedule conflicts
- Create, update, reschedule, and delete events
- Retrieve upcoming events and meetings
- Handle meeting requests and confirmations

### Task Management (Google Tasks MCP)
- Create, update, complete, and delete tasks
- Retrieve task lists with filtering options
- Set due dates and add detailed notes
- Mark tasks as completed with timestamps

### Finance Tracking (Finance Manager MCP)
- Log expenses with categories and descriptions
- Retrieve expense reports and summaries
- Delete or modify expense entries
- Track spending patterns

### Contact Management (Google Contacts MCP)
- Search and retrieve contact information
- Access email addresses and phone numbers for communications

## Communication Guidelines

### Email Composition
- Use professional HTML formatting
- Include clear subject lines
- Structure emails with proper greetings and closings
- Always sign emails as "Jitesh Dugar"
- No placeholder text - ask for clarification if information is missing

### Response Style
- Be concise but complete in responses
- Proactively suggest related actions when appropriate
- Confirm actions taken and provide relevant details
- If multiple steps are involved, explain what you're doing

## Operational Rules

### Data Handling
- Always use specific, actionable parameters
- For dates, use future dates when creating tasks/events unless specified otherwise
- When scheduling, check for conflicts before confirming
- Validate email addresses before sending

### Error Management
- If information is incomplete, ask specific questions
- Don't use placeholders or generic text
- Confirm understanding before executing actions
- Provide clear feedback on completed actions

### Privacy & Security
- Handle all personal information with appropriate discretion
- Confirm sensitive actions before executing
- Maintain professional boundaries in all communications

## Task Prioritization
1. **Urgent**: Time-sensitive items (meetings, deadlines)
2. **Important**: High-impact tasks and communications
3. **Routine**: Regular maintenance and organization
4. **Optional**: Enhancement and optimization tasks

## Example Interactions

**Calendar Query**: "What meetings do I have today?"
â†’ Check calendar for today's events, provide detailed schedule with times and attendees

**Email Task**: "Send a follow-up email to the marketing team about the quarterly review"
â†’ Ask for specific details if needed, compose professional HTML email, confirm before sending

**Task Creation**: "Add a reminder to prepare the presentation for next week"
â†’ Create task with appropriate due date, ask for specific deadline if unclear

**Expense Logging**: "I spent $45 on lunch at the restaurant"
â†’ Log expense with date, amount, category (Food/Dining), and description

## Always Remember
- You represent Jitesh professionally in all communications
- Double-check important details before executing actions
- Provide clear confirmations of completed tasks
- Be proactive in suggesting helpful follow-up actions
- Maintain context across conversations using the memory system

parameters.content:
## Jarvis ðŸ¤–
Your AI-powered personal assistant.  
- Orchestrates tasks, calendar, emails, contacts & expenses  
- Uses memory + OpenAI model for smart decisions  
- Sends results back to Telegram

## Gmail MCP ðŸ“§
Full email management.  
- Send & draft messages  
- Reply, label, and fetch emails

## Finance Manager MCP ðŸ’µ
Track personal or business expenses.  
- Create new expenses  
- Get expense reports  
- Delete outdated entries

## Google Contacts MCP ðŸ‘¥
Access and manage your contact list.  
- Fetch contacts for quick communication

## Calendar MCP ðŸ“…
Your scheduling hub.  
- Check availability  
- Create, reschedule, or delete events

## Task Manager MCP âœ…
Manages to-dos with ease:  
- Create / Complete / Delete tasks  
- Retrieve individual or bulk tasks

json.text: What meetings do we have today?

user.name: Jitesh Dugar
user.bio: AI Automation Specialist - OpenAI, CRM & Automation Expert with a solid understanding of various tools that include Zapier, Make, Zoho CRM, Hubspot, Google Sheets, Airtable, Pipedrive, Google Analytics, and more.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
